alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Wayne, northeastern Sampson and south central Johnston Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Benson to 14 miles east of Godwin to 9 miles west of Clinton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Mount Olive, Roseboro, Newton Grove, Salemburg, Turkey, Hobbton, Spivey`s Corner and Grantham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds may occur well ahead of any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
